noun.description: A titanium-containing mineral occurring as long prismatic crystals of a black or dark brown colour, typically as a constituent of pegmatites.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Dana (1813–1895), geologist, zoologist, and teacher. From German Ainigmatit from ancient Greek αἴνιγμα (with reference to its originally problematic nature) + German -it.
